noun.description: A spiked metal device thrown on the ground to impede wheeled vehicles or (formerly) cavalry horses.
examples: militant demonstrators threw a box of caltrops across the highway

noun.description: A creeping plant with woody carpels that typically have hard spines and resemble military caltrops.

origin: Old English calcatrippe, denoting any plant which tended to catch the feet, from medieval Latin calcatrippa, from calx heel or calcare to tread + a word related to trap. caltrop (sense 1) was probably adopted from French.
